title: WidgetBot
shortDescription: Pixel perfect discord embed for your website!
longDescription:
**Welcome to WidgetBot.io**
WidgetBot is an open-source javascript widget and Discord bot designed to make it easy to embed your Discord server into your website. It allows your website guests to see and reply to messages in real-time, directly on your site - even if they don't have a Discord account.

**Guest messaging**
By utilizing Discord's webhook functionality, guests on your website can send messages to channels on your server and they'll be relayed instantaneously to appear inside Discord! This can be disabled on a per-channel basis.

**Features**
WidgetBot makes most the functionality you've come to expect from Discord available on your website. This includes:
```asciidoc
- Markdown support, embeds and emojis
- Switchable channels & user mentions
- Emoji completion
```

**I want to test it out!**
Sure thing! Simply head to #live-demo over at https://widgetbot.io/ to give it a whirl.

Consider becoming a [Patron](https://www.patreon.com/widgetbot), we really appreciate it!
instructions:
## Inviting the bot
Make sure you invite the bot at this link:
https://add.widgetbot.io/

## Enabling live-chat

1. Make sure WidgetBot has the **“Manage WebHooks”** permission on your Discord server
author: WidgetBot

proposedApp.title: WidgetBot - Discord Chat widgets
proposedApp.shortDescription: Popup Discord chat widgets for your website.
proposedApp.longDescription: Popup Discord chat widgets for your website.
proposedApp.instructions:
1. Head over to [WidgetBot.io](https://widgetbot.io)
2. Click on create widget
3. Sign in with discord
4. Invite the bot to your server
5. In the widgetbot configurator, toggle the channel you want to use to on

## To enable live-chatting
6. Click on `Configure`
7. Make sure WidgetBot has the "manage webhooks" permission on your discord server
8. Toggle the `2-way Chat` button to on.
proposedApp.author: WidgetBot

proposedApp.title: WidgetBot
proposedApp.shortDescription: Popup Discord chat widgets for your website.
proposedApp.longDescription:
WidgetBot gives you the power to embed Discord chats (meaning channels) in the browser, on your website. 

## Features

- Live view of the chat. Just select the channels you want a Widget for and you're all set!
- New messages get displayed instantly, as well as who's typing, message edits and deletions! 
- Allow people to chat from the widget directly to your channel!

# How it works

The WidgetBot is split up into 2 halves: Widget and Server. The Widget is running in the browser, it's what will actually display your Discord channel. Basically a Website that executes in your browser, and connects to the Server. The Server does most of the magic. It hosts the Discord bot, manages the database, and collects&forwards messages to the Widget.

The database is used to save the register state of channels as well as patrons, that get extra benefits. None of your private info is stored in the database, other than your user ID.

# Usage statistics

Currently, the Widget has about **4000 hits per day**, steadily increasing. The Server is in **1167 Guilds**. The server has a monthly cost of 12$, wich I am not able to pay for all by myself. If you want to support the WidgetBot and get extra benefits, you can become a patron below.

Become a [Patron](https://www.patreon.com/bePatron?u=5594164)!
proposedApp.instructions: ## WidgetBot setup 1. Visit WidgetBot.io 2. Press **“Create Widget”** 3. Sign-in with your Discord account 4. Invite the bot to your Discord server 5. In the WidgetBot configurator, add your channel ## Enabling live-chat 1. Make sure WidgetBot has the **“Manage WebHooks”** permission on your Discord server 2. Visit your WidgetBot configuration page 3. Set the **“2-way Chat”** toggle to **on**
proposedApp.author: WidgetBot
